question_text: Which option describes a shared network address?
answer_options: A unique IP assigned to each VM from your router
A virtual IP subnet behind the hypervisor with NAT to access external networks
A local-only IP that never connects to external systems
A manually assigned static IP for each VM
correct_answer: A virtual IP subnet behind the hypervisor with NAT to access external networks
explanation: In shared network setups, the hypervisor uses NAT to translate VM addresses into external traffic.
